title: Calculus of variations
summary: The calculus of variations (or Variational Calculus) is a field of mathematical analysis that uses variations, which are small changes in functions and functionals, to find maxima and minima of functionals: mappings from a set of functions to the real numbers.[lower-alpha 1] Functionals are often expressed as definite integrals involving functions and their derivatives.
